title: Scientific Evaluation, Analysis and Communication
description:
This module aims to equip final pharmacy students with the skills
of performing a literature-based scientific evaluation study in
pharmaceutical science or pharmacy practice. It also aims to
help students develop higher-order thinking and communication
skills through critical review and analysis of literature as well as
via a technical oral presentation. Students will perform their
study under the supervision of Pharmacy academic staff with the
final output as a written report in the format of a review paper.
They will attend classes offered by Centre for English Language
Communication (CELC) to gain knowledge and skills required for
successful scientific communication.
prerequisite:
Completion of Pharmacy Year 3 requirement and have not met
the criteria for reading PR4196 as listed below:
(i) Students who are not within the 50th percentile of the cohort based on their Year 3 Semester 1 CAP score.
(ii) Student who are deemed by the HOD and/or department’s
designated representatives to be unsuitable to read
PR4196 due to medical, personal and safety reasons. For
point 
(ii), accompanying document from a medical
practitioner or testimonial from the students’ supervisor will
be needed to aid in the decision making by the HOD and/or
department’s designated representatives.
(iii) Students who are required to read ES1000/ES1000FC
Basic English and/or ES1102 English for Academic
Purposes must pass these modules.
preclusion:
Students from non-Pharmacy majors, PR4196 unless deemed
unsuitable by the HOD or her representatives
